title: Separate admin artwork upload into a dedicated page (separate from gallery view)

requirements.text: Split the admin artwork upload UI into a dedicated upload page/view, so the gallery view no longer contains the upload form.

quotes: Separate the Artwork uploading page from the gallery view

acceptanceCriteria: When visiting the default view, the user sees the Gallery content without the admin upload form rendered on the same page.
There is a distinct Upload view/page that renders the existing AdminUploadForm component.
The existing gallery browsing behavior (grid + artwork detail dialog) remains available and unchanged from the default Gallery view.

requirements.text: Add in-app navigation to access the separate Upload page and back to Gallery, showing the Upload navigation entry only to authenticated admins; prevent non-admin users from accessing the Upload page.

quotes: Separate the Artwork uploading page from the gallery view

acceptanceCriteria: Header provides a clear navigation option to go to “Gallery” at all times.
Header provides a clear navigation option to go to “Upload” only when the user is authenticated and the backend admin check returns true.

If a non-admin (or unauthenticated) user manually navigates to the Upload page URL/state, the app shows an English access-denied message and a way to return to Gallery (and does not render AdminUploadForm).
Navigating between Gallery and Upload does not break authentication, profile setup flow, or artwork fetching (React Query continues to work).

constraints: Frontend must not modify any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths (must compose existing UI components rather than editing them).
Do not introduce additional backend services or databases; keep changes within the existing React + Motoko single-actor setup.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Changing backend authorization/admin logic or how admin status is determined.
Adding new artwork fields, categories, purchasing, payments, or other new product features.
Redesigning the existing AdminUploadForm functionality beyond moving it into a separate page/view.
